dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
dcterms:description: CIFAR is a dataset commonly used for training machine learning models, particularly in the field of computer vision. It consists of 60,000 32x32 color images in 10 classes, with 6,000 images per class.
dcterms:title: CIFAR

dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
dcterms:description: CIFAR10 is a subset of the CIFAR dataset, consisting of 60,000 32x32 color images in 10 classes, with 6,000 images per class. It is widely used for benchmarking machine learning algorithms.
dcterms:title: CIFAR10

dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
dcterms:description: CIFAR100 is another subset of the CIFAR dataset, consisting of 60,000 32x32 color images in 100 classes, with 600 images per class. It is used for more fine-grained classification tasks.
dcterms:title: CIFAR100

dcterms:creator: Mingxing Tan
Bo Chen
Ruoming Pang
Vijay Vasudevan
Quoc V. Le
dcterms:description: ImageNet is a large-scale dataset used for visual recognition tasks, containing millions of images across thousands of categories. It is a standard benchmark for evaluating image classification algorithms.
dcterms:title: ImageNet
